section.p: She executes a sudden merciless attack, her pretty face transforming in an instant to a snarl of inhuman rage. But her fierce expression is soon wiped away when she sees the fake blade snap against the buckle of your belt.
Gaping in dismay, she takes a step backwards. ‘I’m defeated!’
You give her a buccaneer’s grin. ‘Madam, I cheated.’
‘It makes no difference.’ She slumps in dejection. ‘Father always tells us that trickery is half the battle.’
She pulls an agate swan pendant from around her neck and hands it to you.
‘If you ever need to cross the bridge again, show this to whichever of my sisters is on duty. That way she’ll know better than to tangle with you.’
